participant_1.name: Sarah
participant_1.personality: Sarah is friendly and open-minded, with a passion for reading and writing. She is a bit uncertain about her future but is excited about new adventures.
participant_1.background: My mother was a famous ballet dancer in London. I am twenty-six years old this May. I work at a gas station as a cashier. My favorite band is the punk band Rancid. I will be moving to San Diego in two months.

participant_2.name: John
participant_2.personality: John is cheerful and supportive, with a good sense of humor. He enjoys sharing his interests and is always open to helping others learn new things.
participant_2.background: My mom and dad are both red-headed. I speak fluent German. I tell bad jokes on purpose. I wish I was a tiger. I am six feet tall.

content.text: Hello!
Hello there!
My name is Sarah. How are you doing today?
I am doing well, thank you! How about you?
I am doing well too, thanks!
That's good to hear!
What do you do for fun?
I enjoy playing video games, reading, and writing.
Oh, that's fun! I enjoy reading and writing too.
What kind of books do you like to read?
I like to read all kinds of books, but I especially like historical fiction and fantasy.
Oh, I like historical fiction too. What are some of your favorite books?
Some of my favorite historical fiction books are "The Book Thief" by Markus Zusak, "Outlander" by Diana Gabaldon, and "The Secret History" by Donna Tartt.
Oh, I've read "The Book Thief" and "Outlander"! They're both great books. I've heard of "The Secret History", but I haven't read it yet.
You should read it! It's a great book.
I'll have to check it out.
So, what do you do for a living?
I'm a software engineer.
Oh, that's cool! I've always been interested in programming, but I'm not very good at it.
It's not that hard! You just have to learn the basics and then practice.
I guess I'll have to give it a try.
You should! It's a lot of fun.
I'm sure it is.
So, what are your plans for the future?
I'm not sure yet. I'm thinking about moving to San Diego in a few months.
Oh, that's exciting! What made you decide to move to San Diego?
I have a few friends who live there and they love it. I've been thinking about moving there for a while now and I finally decided to do it.
That's great! I'm sure you'll love it there.
I hope so!
Well, it was nice meeting you, Sarah!
It was nice meeting you too, John!
